channel.title: NYT > Business > Economy
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: Trump Administration Keeps Pressure on Powell Over Rate Cuts and Renovations
item.description: President Trump and his top aides have criticized Jerome H. Powell, the Fed chair, for his management of both the economy and a $2.5 billion revamp of the central bank’s headquarters.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith

item.title: Trump Administration Keeps 19 Percent Tariff on Indonesia in Trade Deal
item.description: The administration provided some insight into the terms that were agreed upon between Indonesia and the United States, hinting at how other vague and hastily negotiated deals may turn out.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Philippines’ Leader Meets With Trump to Clinch Trade Deal
item.description: President Trump announced that he had secured a deal with the country that will leave a 19 percent tariff in place, though no details were immediately available.
item.dc:creator: Luke Broadwater and Ana Swanson

item.title: As Trump Courts a More Assertive Beijing, China Hawks Are Losing Out
item.description: The Trump administration has dialed back aggressive measures against China and reversed its position on technology controls as the president angles for a Chinese trip later this year.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson and Tripp Mickle

item.title: Trump Announces ‘Great Deal’ on Trade With Indonesia
item.description: President Trump said the agreement would partly walk back some of the steep tariffs he threatened on the country last week. Indonesia’s president called Mr. Trump a “tough negotiator.”
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson and Alexandra Stevenson

item.title: Rising Inflation Underscores Risks in Trump’s New Tariff Threats
item.description: New data showing price increases last month could foreshadow even higher costs if the president imposes steep tariffs on Aug. 1.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm and Colby Smith

item.title: The Economy Has Been Resilient. The New Round of Tariffs May Hit Harder.
item.description: The economy’s resilience so far to President Trump’s global trade war risks emboldening him and unleashing the sort of economic devastation that economists have long feared.
item.dc:creator: Colby Smith and Tony Romm

item.title: Trump Adds 17% Tariff on Tomatoes From Mexico
item.description: The Trump administration is adding a 17 percent tariff to a year-round grocery store staple, while funneling more business to domestic tomato growers, largely in Florida.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: It’s No Bluff: The Tariff Rate Is Soaring Under Trump
item.description: The president has earned a reputation for bluffing on tariffs. But he has steadily and dramatically raised U.S. tariffs, transforming global trade.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: He Helped Big Companies Dodge Taxes. Now He’s Writing the Rules.
item.description: Ken Kies, a longtime tax lobbyist who worked for some of the world’s largest businesses, is now running the Treasury Department’s office that will administer Trump’s tax law.
item.dc:creator: Jesse Drucker

item.title: To Sidestep Trump Tariffs, Asian Nations Seek New Trade Partners
item.description: Most nations are still negotiating in hopes of avoiding punitive import taxes. At the same time, they’re looking for trading partners as a way around the United States.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis

item.title: Trump Escalates Tariff Threats, Showing Little Interest in New Trade Deals
item.description: The president’s supporters portray him as a top dealmaker. But, at least for now, far more trading partners have gotten stiff tariffs than trade deals.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: As Trump Sows Tariff Confusion, Rules of Global Commerce Give Way to Chaos
item.description: Blunt letters dictating terms posted to social media and changes late in negotiations have left trading partners wondering what President Trump will do next.
item.dc:creator: Jeanna Smialek and Ana Swanson

item.title: Trump Fuels Fear Among Immigrant Farm Workers in California’s Central Valley
item.description: The fertile valley feeds the world. President Trump has thrown farmers and farmworkers there into turmoil, but recently offered them a glimmer of hope.
item.dc:creator: Elisabeth Bumiller and Zaydee Sanchez

item.title: Trump Tariffs Aim to Settle Scores With Countries, No Matter Their Size
item.description: The president’s tariff announcements suggest he has not backed away from his initial strategy, where even smaller trading partners will face tariffs.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: Trump Treats Tariffs More as a Form of Power Than as a Trade Tool
item.description: Instead of viewing tariffs as part of a broader trade policy, President Trump sees them as a valuable weapon he can wield on the world stage.
item.dc:creator: Maggie Haberman

item.title: Trump Takes Reins on U.S. Economy With Policy Bill and Tariffs Renewal
item.description: President Trump has achieved much of his agenda, leaving the fate of the economy squarely in his hands.
item.dc:creator: Tony Romm and Colby Smith

item.title: What Is a Trade Deal? Trump Takes an Expansive View.
item.description: The president is deploying the word “deal” liberally, using the term to describe all kinds of trade arrangements, some very limited or one-sided.
item.dc:creator: Ana Swanson

item.title: The Mexican Businessman Grateful for Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: A small company in northern Mexico had faced steep competition from China in making straps, plugs, fasteners, grommets, zip ties and clamps. Now, U.S. tariffs have driven a spike in his business.
item.dc:creator: Emiliano Rodríguez Mega and César Rodríguez

item.title: Trump’s New Trade Threats Set Off Global Scramble to Avoid Tariffs
item.description: Many countries thought they were negotiating in good faith. The White House renewed its “reciprocal” tariff plan anyway, giving countries until Aug. 1 to make offers.
item.dc:creator: Lydia DePillis, Alexandra Stevenson, River Akira Davis, Choe Sang-Hun, Meaghan Tobin and Daisuke Wakabayashi
